question: Where did Waupee live?
answer1: in a remote part of the forest where animals abounded

question: Why did Waupee return from the chase with a large spoil?
answer1: He was one of the most skillful and lucky hunters of his tribe.

question: What did Waupee come across after walking for some time without a path?
answer1: a ring

question: Why was it strange to find a rind worn among the grass and flowers?
answer1: There was no path which led to this flowery circle.
answer2: no sign of people in the area

question: Who appeared out of the basket?
answer1: twelve sisters

question: What happened after the sisters discovered Waupee?
answer1: The sisters leaped back into the basket, and were drawn up into the sky.

question: Who was the White Hawk most pleased with?
answer1: the youngest

question: Why was looking at the sky painful to White Hawk now?
answer1: It had withdrawn from his sight the only being he had ever loved.

question: How did Waupee feel when the casted off his disguise?
answer1: sorrowful

question: What did Waupee do to deceive the sisters?
answer1: assumed the form of an opossum, and sat among the grass as if he were there engaged in chewing the cud

question: What did the sisters do when Waupee crept slowly towards the ring?
answer1: caught sight of him they were startled, and sprang into their car

question: Why did Waupee turn into a mouse?
answer1: was so pleased with their tidy little forms
answer2: They were by no means formidable to look at, and would not be at all likely to create alarm.

question: How did Waupee keep his attention to the sisters?
answer1: kept one eye up toward the sky, and one ear wide open in the same direction

question: Why was the younger sister suspicious of the stump?
answer1: That stump was not there before.

question: What did Waupee do just as the younger sister raised a silver stick?
answer1: The form of the White Hawk arose, and he clasped his prize in his arms.

question: Who was Waupee's wife?
answer1: the daughter of one of the stars

question: What did White Hawk's wife do while he was engaged in the chase?
answer1: constructed a wicker basket

question: What happened after Waupee's wife commenced her magical song?
answer1: The basket rose.

question: Why did Waupee instantly run to the prairie?
answer1: heard a voice which he well knew

question: How will Waupee feel when the basket vanished in the sky?
answer1: miserable

question: Why did Waupee miss his son more than his wife?
answer1: The boy had both the mother's beauty and the father's strength.

question: What did the grandfather tell his daughter to ask Waupee to bring?
answer1: a specimen of each kind of bird and animal he kills in the chase

question: What did Waupee preserve from each animal and bird?
answer1: a foot, a wing, or a tail of each

question: Where was Waupee's favorite spot?
answer1: the hill-top

question: What happened to those that selected tails or claws?
answer1: changed into animals, and ran off

question: What did Waupee, his wife, and his son become?
answer1: white hawks

question: Why was the magic circle of  Waupee's favorite spots?
answer1: was where he met his wife
answer2: was where he flew to heaven

question: Why did the twelve sisters leap back into the basket?
answer1: White Hawk scared them.
answer2: They were afraid of getting hurt.
answer3: They wanted to go back to the skies.

question: How will White Hawk feel when the twelve sisters draw up into the sky?
answer1: sad

question: What will happen if the sisters catch Waupee a third time?
answer1: The sisters will ascend to the sky.
answer2: The sisters will never return to earth.
answer3: The sisters will punish White Hawk.

question: Why did Waupee keep his sharp little eyes busy with the other mice?
answer1: to pretend to be a real mouse

question: How will the younger sister feel when White Hawk clasps her?
answer1: scared

question: Why did the wife not want to tell White Hawk she missed her father?
answer1: did not want to make White Hawk upset
answer3: wanted to stay with her husband and son

question: Why did the wife's father want his son-in-law to bring samples of his hunt?
answer1: to prove his skills
answer2: to provide food for a feast
answer3: to have a token of the earth
